title.narrative: Strengthening the National Statistical System of Zambia
Stärkande av det nationella statistiksystemet i Zambia

description.narrative: Long-term outcome (impact) The project shall contribute to, together with other development interventions, that Policy makers in Zambia use unbiased, reliable and quality information to design polices that contribute to a sustainable development of the country. Project Objective Users have increased access to unbiased, reliable and quality statistics that are timely, accurate and relevant to meet user needs Component outcomes 1. Coordination: Strengthened National Statistical System 2. Statistical production: Improved range and quality of CSO’s statistical production 3. Communication and dissemination: Increased user access and improved user understanding of existing statistics 4. Information and Communication Technology: An ICT environment in place that supports efficient statistics production

Ambassaden har mottagit en gemensam projektansökan från Zambia Statistics Agency (Zamstats) och Statistiska Centralbyrån (SCB) med namnet "Increased access to statistics that are relevant to meet user needs". Projektetförslaget har en total budget på SEK 44 434 000 och är resultat av en förberedelsefas som genomförts av de två organisationerna under perioden februari till juli 2019 och som finansierades av Ambassaden med en budget av SEK 1 183 000.
Den föreslagna insatsen kommer att genomföras gemensamt av Zamstats och SCB under perioden 2019 - 2023. Projektmålet är att användarna har ökad tillgång till oberoende, tillförlitlig och högkvalitativ statistik som publiceras i god tid, är korrekt och relevant och möter användarnas efterfrågan och behov. Projektet är indelat i fyra komponenter. Den första är Koordinering och det förväntade resultatet är ett stärkt system för nationell statistik (NSS). Den andra komponenten är Statistikproduktion och det förväntade resultatet är en förbättrad omfattning och kvalitet av Zamstats statistikproduktion. Den tredje komponenten är Kommunikation och spridning och det förväntade resultatet är ökad tillgång till och förståelse hos användare av statistik. Den fjärde komponenten är ICT och det förväntade resultatet är en existerande ICT-miljö som stödjer effektiv statistikproduktion.

The Embassy has received a joint project proposal from Zambia Statistics Agency and Statistics Sweden called "Increased access to statistics that are relevant to meet user needs". The proposal has a total budget of SEK 44 434 000 and is the outcome of a scoping phase implemented by Zamstats and Statistics Sweden between February and July 2019 and financed by the Embassy with a budget of SEK 1 183 000.
The proposed contribution is a collaboration between the Zambia Statistics Agency and Statistics Sweden over the period 2019 - 2023. The objective of the project is that users have increased access to unbiased, reliable and quality statistics that are timely, accurate and relevant to meet their needs. The project is divided into four project components. The first component is Coordination and the expected outcome is a strengthened National Statistical System. The second component is Statistical Production and the expected outcome is improved range and quality of Zamstats’ statistical production. The third component is Communication and Dissemination and the expected outcome is increased user access and improved user understanding of existing statistics. The fourth component is Information and Communication Technology and the expected outcome is an ICT environment in place that supports efficient statistics production.

title.narrative: Agreement Statistics Sweden Strengthening the National Statistical System of Zambia
Decision on Contribution Statistics Sweden Strengthening the National Statistical System of Zambia

description.narrative: The contribution started in December 2019 and has thus been ongoing for one and a half years. From February 2020 very few activities have been possible to implement due to restrictions on meetings and travel related to the ongoing covid-19 pandemic. This has led to large delays in the implementation of the project and it is likely that the implementation period will have to be extended. Early 2020, a few short-term missions by Statistics Sweden to Zambia were possible before the pandemic made the implementation difficult. In November 2020, the long-term advisor from Statistics Sweden was able to move to Zambia. On Africa Statistics Day, 18 November, the official launch of the project was held in Lusaka with visitors from Statistics Sweden and participation from the Swedish Embassy in Lusaka. In connection to the launch, five workshops were held to make a renewed assessment of the relevance of the project components and provide a start line for the work. The activities during 2020 has provided some initial progress, primarily on component 2: Statistical Production where for example the concept of quality in statistics was discussed and an agreement was reached on the importance of quality reports under the new Statistics Act and Component 4: ICT where several detailed plans for the upcoming work were agreed upon between Zamstats and Statistics Sweden. The draft results framework of the project was finalised and submitted to the Embassy on 31 December. The framework specifies the different outputs that are needed in order to produce the expected outcomes. It also includes indicators and milestones.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
